No education system can change a student’s learning skills. Psychologists say in young children the ability to memorise is high but not logical thinking Therefore, at primary school level, what is important is help a pupil memorise as many nursery rhymes, tables, spelling of words, mathematical equations as possible. When children go to higher classes like middle or high school they can grasp the logic behind what they learn. It is for this reason in olden days we had clearly demarcated primary, middle and high school. And each school and faculty would be different. They would not even be located in the same campus. But now, right from standard one to standard 12 we have the same school same teachers and common off syllabus activities. What psychological impact it has on younger children, good or bad , is difficult to judge. In any case what ever may be the split in the teaching pattern a child will only pick up what he or she is capable of according the age. There may be exceptions but it is important to discuss the rule and not the exceptions to the rule.

Our education system is already very expensive but because of NEP this education system will be more expensive .Poor students will suffer.
